revised_title: Attenuation of Spherical Shocks and Large Distances
tldr: The paper investigates the attenuation of spherical shocks at large distances from the origin, developing a general theory of spherical wave motion. The linearized approximations of the sound wave theory are found to be invalid at large distances, so a modified theory is used to provide a uniformly valid solution for all distances. The results are applied to the case of explosions and show the connection between the flow at large distances and that near the source.
